marytts.datatypes
Class MaryData

java.lang.Object
  marytts.datatypes.MaryData

public class MaryData
extends java.lang.Object

A representation of any type of mary data, be it input, intermediate or output data. The "technical" representation of the read data is hidden from the caller, but can be accessed on request. Internally, the data is appropriately represented according to this data's type, i.e. as a String containing plain text, an XML DOM tree, or an input stream containing audio data.

Author:
Marc Schröder

readFrom

public void readFrom(java.io.InputStream is,
                     java.lang.String endMarker)
              throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                     org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                     java.io.IOException,
                     javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException,
                     javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Read data from input stream is, in the appropriate way as determined by our type.

Parameters:
is - the InputStream from which to read.
endMarker - a string marking end of file. If this is null, read until end-of-file; if it is non-null, read up to (and including) the first line containing the end marker string. This will be ignored for audio data.
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException
javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException

readFrom

public void readFrom(java.io.Reader from)
              throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                     org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                     java.io.IOException
Read data from reader r in the appropriate way as determined by our type. Only XML and Text data can be read from a reader, audio data cannot.

Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException

readFrom

public void readFrom(java.io.Reader from,
                     java.lang.String endMarker)
              throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                     org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                     java.io.IOException
Read data from reader r in the appropriate way as determined by our type. Only XML and Text data can be read from a reader, audio data cannot. "Helpers" needed to read the data, such as XML parser objects, are created when they are needed. If doWarnClient is set to true, warning and error messages related to XML parsing are logged to the log category connected to the client from which this request originated.

Parameters:
from - the Reader from which to read.
endMarker - a string marking end of file. If this is null, read until end-of-file; if it is non-null, read up to (and including) the first line containing the end marker string.
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException

setData

public void setData(java.lang.String dataString)
             throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                    org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                    java.io.IOException
Set the content data of this MaryData object from the given String. For XML data (MaryDataType.isXMLType()), parse the String representation of the data into a DOM tree.

Parameters:
dataString - string representation of the input data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this method is called for MaryDataTypes that are neither text nor XML.
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException

setAudio

public void setAudio(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audio)
Set the audio data. This will discard any previously set audio data. If audio data is to be appended, consider appendAudio().

Parameters:
audio -

setAudioFileFormat

public void setAudioFileFormat(javax.sound.sampled.AudioFileFormat audioFileFormat)
The audio file format is required only for data types serving as input to modules producing AUDIO data (e.g., MBROLA data), as well as for the AUDIO data itself. It should be set by the calling code before passing the data to the module producing AUDIO data.

getAudioFileFormat

public javax.sound.sampled.AudioFileFormat getAudioFileFormat()

append

public void append(MaryData md)

appendAudio

public void appendAudio(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audioToAppend)
For audio data, append more audio data to the one currently present. If no audio data is set yet, this call is equivalent to setAudio().

Parameters:
audioToAppend - the new audio data to append
